reviews.review_msg: In his videos, he skips important topics despite them being very significant for the course. He doesn't read the PowerPoint before presenting. Teaching yourself.TA is on strike yet he is doing. Your main support for questions is not there, he sent an email to everyone saying do not contact him unless you are sick or in dire need.

Went into this class thinking I was gonna fail and came out with the A- 

Just listen to what he says

Scott might not explain stuff in the best way, but it's important to attend lectures cuz you will get a general sense; coupled with the homework assigned and practice exam and some extra learning, you will be ok. It would be awesome if you read the textbook, but it didn't help me much. Textbook is required for assignments and stat tables though.

Despite the other poor reviews,  Scott is a decent prof, has a good sense of humor, and was helpful when I had questions during or outside of class. However his teaching method is a bit slow-paced and notes can be disorganized at times, attending class is also a must as he goes over examples similar to those that you will find in HW and exams.

Even though he's a bit messy, he's not a bad teacher. I went into the class with no stats/math skills and now nearing the end of the year I've learned so much. Just listen to him and read his notes/textbook, watch the videos and go to the lecture, you will be okay. His tests and HW are not as bad as everyone is saying, and his classes are funny af

He is definitely hard to understand and his notes are messy. He did made us go to campus during the strike which was for sure awkward. He seem like a nice prof. But don't take the class if you aren't willing to put up the extra hours of studying after his lecture.

He is a nice person but he should consider that STAT 201 should the more application-based rather than just solving numericals. 
If you want to score well in his exams, practice the sample exams by him thoroughly as he puts kinda same questions in the exams.

His lectures are garbage, cannot understand anything he says, and he talks very slowly and starts talking about irrelevant things. Tests are mostly multiple-choice, but questions are worded strangely, almost like he wants you to do badly. Have to basically teach yourself everything. Hardly replies to emails.
I found lectures hard to follow and learned more on my own then in class. Also questions on tests are worded weirdly.
I was scared of the bad reviews but he's not that bad. Quite adorable ngl and weirdly funny
Do not take this class with this prof unless you absolutely have to. You will regret it.

One of the funniest profs, definitely explains concepts really well, but the homework is tedious and not helpful at all. The exams have questions  are nothing like the homework questionslecture questions. Have to work extremely hard to do well. The final was way too difficult

Funny guy but not my favourite teacher. His assignments are too long and useless (we had to do roughly 20 end of chapter problems every week). His exams questions are nothing like book problems. We had 2 midterms which were mostly mc's and TF with only one calculation problem. The final exam was extremely difficult but scaled.

She is a nice prof but she isn't clear in her explanations. She frequently revises her notes after using them in lecture. Her assignments are really long and are mostly textbook questions.You will be learning more from the textbook than from her
